translations.translation: From the evil of sorceresses who blow incantations on knots,
from the evil of the women who blow on knots;
from the evil of those who practice witchcraft
“And from the evil of the witches who blow into knots.”
And from the evil of the blowers in knots,"
And from the evil of those who blow on knots,
from the evil of the women who blow on knots,
And from the evil of malignant witchcraft,
from the evil of those who blow on knots
And from the evil of the women blowers upon knots,
and from the evil of the witches, who blow on knots,
From the mischief of those who practise secret arts;
And from the evil of the witchcrafts when they blow in the knots,
from the evil of the blowers on knots;
And from the evil of those who practice sorcery.
And from the evil of the blowers in knots

[113:4] and from the evil of the women-blowers, sorceresses who blow, on knots, which they knot into strings, blowing into them [certain] words, but without spittle; however, al-Zamakhsharī says, ‘with this [spittle]’ — [sorceresses] such as the daughters of the said Labīd —
And from the evil of malignant witchcraft,

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي ٱلْعُقَدِ } معناه السَّواحرُ يَنفِثنَّ في الظُلمِ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَ } كذا { مِن شَرِّ } النساء السواحر { ٱلنَّفَّاثَاتِ } النافخات بريق أفواههن { فِي ٱلْعُقَدِ } [الفلق: 4] التي عقدن على الخيط؛ ليسحرن الناس بها
